parseSocketAddress

public static java.net.InetSocketAddress parseSocketAddress(java.lang.String s,
                                                            java.net.InetAddress defaultHost,
                                                            int defaultPort)
                                                     throws java.text.ParseException,
                                                            java.net.UnknownHostException
Generate a InetSocketAddress from a string of the form "[host][:port]".

Parameters:
s - the string containing the addresses.
defaultHost - Host to use if the string doesn't contain a host part. If null string must contain a host part.
defaultPort - Port to use if the string doesn't contain a port part. If -1 string must contain a host part.
Returns:
a parsed address
Throws:
java.text.ParseException
java.net.UnknownHostException

intToByteArray

public static void intToByteArray(int i,
                                  byte[] a,
                                  int o)
Convert an int to a byte array and put the bytes in the given array.

Parameters:
i - the int to convert.
a - the byte array where to place the converted bytes
o - the offset.
